KnowledgeBase.Title: ncompareLT
KnowledgeBase.RelatedFunctions: ncompare ncompareEQ ncompareNE ncompareGE ncompareGT ncompareLE

Function.Description: The ncompareLT is a fast comparison function that assume that its operands are Number values. It returns true if the first object is lesser than the second object and false if otherwise.

Brief.Overview: The ncompareLT is a fast comparison function that assume that its operands are Number values. The resulting value is a Boolean value of true or false. The operands are not checked and are not coerced.
Brief.Usage: Use the ncompareLT function when you wish to compare two Numbers and determine if {num1} is lesser than {num2} and you wish the result to be expressed as a Boolean value (true or false). These functions only operate on Number operands. For a more general, but slower, comparison, use the compareEQ, compareNE, compareGT, compareGE, compareLT, and compareLE which performs type checking and type conversions.

Argument.Name: num1
Argument.Note: The first Number to be compared

Syntax.Return: Returns true if the first Number is lesser than the second Number and false if the first Number is greater or equal in value than the second Number.
